result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shantel Elise Schmock

records.addlTxt: Uploaded warrant document to ShareFile and sent paper copy to Sheriff's Department.  No warrant card generated.

3:20 PM Defendant Shantel Elise Schmock not in court.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Shantel Elise Schmock.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances. Court reviews court record and notes DEF non-appearance. Hearing was set for an Arraignment. Atty Thomas-Schmidt has no information on DEF location. State requests a bench warrant for Wisconsin and Surrounding States. Court authorizes warrant and orders bail bond forfeitures to commence.
Bail/Bond Review scheduled for November 25, 2022 at 09:00 am.

11:32 AM Defendant Shantel Elise Schmock in court.  Attorney Stephanie E Thomas-Schmidt in court for Shantel Elise Schmock.  Attorney Kenneth N. Sortedahl appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case and recites appearances.   Atty Thomas-Schmidt indicates DEF waives preliminary hearing.  Court advised the DEF as to her right to prelim.  DEF does not wish to have prelim.  Court finds defendant freely waived her right to prelim finds probable cause and binds defendant over for trial. Next Court Appearance Card completed by Court Officer and given to DEF.   Bond Continues.
Arraignment scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt:
ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY/ No Possession or Consumption of Alcoholic Beverages.  May not possess any controlled substance or paraphernalia.     No drug use without a valid prescription and if prescribed must take as DR ordered.  

Defendant shall be subject to testing of their blood, breath, saliva and/or urine to ensure compliance with absolute sobriety provision. Within 24 hours of release from custody (not including weekends/holidays) defendant shall report to Justice Point Pre-Trial Services at 10610 Main Street Suite 101, Hayward, WI 54843. Phone: 715-804-0109 OR 715-961-0149 for orientation and to establish testing procedures and options.
